findings.title: Solidity assert violation
findings.description: The audit report identifies a Solidity assert violation.

findings.title: Solidity AssertionFailed event
findings.description: The contract has a Solidity AssertionFailed event which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Incorrect ERC20 implementation
findings.description: The contract does not conform to the ERC20 standard.

findings.title: Outdated compiler version
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: No or floating compiler version set
findings.description: The compiler version used to compile the smart contract is not specified or is a floating version, which can lead to unexpected behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of right-to-left-override control character
findings.description: The use of right-to-left-override control characters can lead to unintended behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Shadowing of built-in symbol
findings.description: The contract shadows a built-in symbol which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Incorrect constructor name
findings.description: The constructor name does not match the contract name.

findings.title: State variable shadows another state variable
findings.description: A state variable is shadowing another state variable.

findings.title: Local variable shadows a state variable
findings.description: A local variable has the same name as a state variable, potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Function parameter shadows a state variable
findings.description: A function parameter has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to confusion and unintended behavior.

findings.title: Named return value shadows a state variable
findings.description: This finding indicates that a named return value is shadowing a state variable, which can lead to confusion and potential security issues.

findings.title: Unary operation without effect Solidity code analysis
findings.description: The unary operation has no effect on the variable and can potentially lead to unintended behavior or incorrect results.

findings.title: Unary operation directly after assignment
findings.description: Unary operation without effect Solidity code analysis and performed directly after an assignment.

findings.title: Unused state variable
findings.description: The contract has a state variable that is declared but not used anywhere in the code.

findings.title: Unused local variable
findings.description: The function contains a local variable that is declared but never used.

findings.title: Function visibility is not set
findings.description: The function does not have its visibility explicitly set.

findings.title: State variable visibility is not set
findings.description: The visibility of a state variable has not been explicitly set.

findings.title: Use of deprecated functions: call code(), sha3(), …
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity functions such as call code(), sha3(), etc.

findings.title: Use of deprecated global variables (msg.gas, …)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated global variables such as msg.gas.

findings.title: Use of deprecated keywords (throw, var)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity keywords such as 'throw' and 'var', which can lead to compatibility issues.

findings.title: Incorrect function state mutability
findings.description: The function's state mutability is incorrectly set.

findings.title: Constable states
findings.description: Variables Grumpee._decimals, Grumpee._name, and Grumpee._symbol should be declared as constant.

findings.title: External Function
findings.description: Functions should be declared external

findings.title: Shadowing-local
findings.description: Local variables shadow state variables from Ownable contract.

findings.title: Divide before multiply
findings.description: _getUValues function performs a multiplication on the result of a division which can lead to precision loss.
